title: Display Driver crash after every game.
body:
After every game I play my screen goes black before the end of game screen appears and my display drivers crash.  Once they crash it takes a computer restart to get them back.  When the drivers crash it causes me to get logged out of windows.

This has been happening for the last 2 Nvidia drivers and I have tried running as Admin with no success.

I just updated and am running the GeForce V. 373.06 drivers which I hoped would fix it with no luck.
I have run the repair tool several times with no success as well.  

Operating System
Windows 10 Pro 64-bit
	CPU
		Intel Core i5 6600K @ 3.50GHz
	RAM
		16.0GB G.Skill Ripsaw 3200 @ 1662MHz (17-19-19-40)
	Motherboard
		MSI Z170A GAMING M3 (MS-7978) (U3E1)	
	Graphics
		ROG PG278Q (2560x1440@59Hz)
		ASUS VS247 (1920x1080@60Hz)
		4095MB NVIDIA GeForce GTX 760 (EVGA)

replies.body:
Well I did a clean uninstall of drivers and installed the drivers you linked. 

* Thought all was well for a couple games but it started again almost right away.

Just double checked to make sure my drivers didn't update while I wasn't looking but I am still on the 368.81.

I am going to be changing video cards in a couple weeks so If no one comes up with another Idea for me I will just have to tough it out until then and see if that fixes it.

It sounds like your system could be having an issue with the recent drivers. I recommend installing [this driver version](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/105037/en-us) after completing a [clean uninstall](http://www.nvidia.com/object/IO_13955.html) of your current driver.

Let me know if those steps resolved this.
Will download and give that a try, Thank you!
